intro: Tetraneuris leptoclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetraneuris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Tetraneuris leptoclada is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
